rename.from: Firefox save as permissions denied / a simple permissions error?
rename.to: Firefox /WinApps with save dialog save as permissions denied / a simple permissions error?

body: Can you try `--vfs-cache-mode writes` and see if that helps?

Hello,
thx for you answer. No sorry this parameter don't helps. I can make normal file system operations like copy move and create dir, but when a software want to direct save an file it don't work. Strange is that i can overwrite the zeroy byte file without problems and in the dialogs make directorys.

@ncw 

Hello, can it be that this is an cache permission problem under windows? The permissions of the cache-dir ist like the normal PermissionsTable of the Windows 10 Permissions and the mounted Folders and File have the special Permissions-Table from WinFSP. WinFSP use a completly different permission table.

For normal Copy,Move and Create Folder file operations it gives no problem. But the file operations Create File causes an error.

For the mount operations winfsp is the controller and for the file operations rclone is the controller.

Only use --vfs-cache-mod=off solves the problem in the moment. I hope it gives a Solutions now i can say the --vfs-cache-mod higher than minimal is the problem.

> @ncw
> 
> Hello, can it be that this is an cache permission problem under windows? The permissions of the cache-dir ist like the normal PermissionsTable of the Windows 10 Permissions and the mounted Folders and File have the special Permissions-Table from WinFSP. WinFSP use a completly different permission table.
> 
> For normal Copy,Move and Create Folder file operations it gives no problem. But the file operations Create File causes an error.
> 
> For the mount operations winfsp is the controller and for the file operations rclone is the controller.
> 
> Only use --vfs-cache-mod=off solves the problem in the moment. I hope it gives a Solutions now i can say the --vfs-cache-mod higher than minimal is the problem.

Sorry for the delay in replying.

interesting that you've narrowed it down to the `--vfs-cache-mode`.  There is probably something wrong there.

Can you run `rclone mount` with `-vv --log-file rclone.log`, make the problem happen then post the log here?  That would be very helpful - thank you.

Hi,

I have the same issue when I use `--vfs-cache-mode`. Any application that tries to save into the mounted drive just hangs 

I tried to use `--vfs-cache-mode off` and in that case, application aparently does something but it never finishes the job. For example, if I download something using Chrome, I can see the file on the drive but the final write of the file never finishes. 

If I CTRL+C in the cmd window, I get the following

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3791124/48770376-5ba0b400-ecbe-11e8-876f-d01dbea8e57b.png)

Is there a way to truncate log file so I can remove all the file names from it so I can post a log here? I don't want for everybody to see my list of files which is visible in the rclone.log file

Update:

If I set `--vfs-cache-mode off` Firefox finishes the download correctly. It seems that Chrome has some issues when there is no cache 

Also, Word first save the doc in the mounted drive, but then it starts to complain about it and when you close it (Word), the file gets deleted

It's a strange bug. All File operations will be done correctly with all vfs-cache-modes but when a non os-app want's to save it's don't functioned. At the moment i use `--vfs-cache-mode off` to resolve this and hope this bug can be fixed.
Is there a way to truncate log file so I can remove all the file names from it so I can post a log here? I don't want for everybody to see my list of files which is visible in the rclone.log file

You can email them privately to me at nick@craig-wood.com if you want.  Put "rclone issue #2730" in the title so I can keep them straight.

Otherwise you can manually edit the log files if you want.
Newest PreRelease from WinFsp don't resolve the bug:(. Only for information that i have tested it and we can exclude that the last PreRelease from WinFsp can resolve this bug.

PS:

When i provocate the error and then hit strg+c to end the service he must became a second strg+c to end the service why he cannot delete the temp-cache-dir.
